introduction:
I am a second-year Ph.D. student from SCSE of Nanyang Technological University (NTU), supervised by Prof. Mo Li and co-supervised by Assoc. Prof. Rui Tan. I received my B.S. degree in School of Software from Nanjing University (NJU), and Master's degree in SEIEE from Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU) under the supervision of Prof. Dong Wang.

I am broadly interested in ubiquitous computing, especially in related fields of building wearable-based or wireless-based sensing interfaces to bridge gaps between computing resources and human's daily lives. My current research focuses on wearable-based sensing, including human activity recognition, localization, authentication, etc.

project.name: RFID-based Localization
project.intro: Analyze the features of RFID signals and design robust indoor localization to locate RFID tags accurately. We propose deep learning enhance holography (DLEH) to design adaptive localization model by combing RFID based synthetic aperture radar (SAR) and convolutional neural network (CNN). We also introduce compress sensing algorithms into RFID localization.

project.name: Human Activity Recognition
project.intro: Recognize the human activity with IMU sensor data collected at mobile devices. We propose a BERT-like self-supervised representation learning for IMU data, which extracts generalized features and substantially reduces the supervised training overhead for down-stream task-specific sensing models.
